title: Quinn ult idea
body:
How about making Quinn more of an assassin type champion rather than a Marksman, her ult, instead of summoning Valor, would let her disappear  in the sky for up to 3 seconds after a 1.5 second channel, while airborne, Quinn ignores all forms of collision in the process, even walls, except the map borders, gains extra movement speed and can cast Heightened Senses if not on cooldown. While the effect is active she can then reactivate her ult to land or automatically land after the duration ends, casting Skystrike at the area. While in the air, her position will be revealed to allies and enemies alike, and if the duration ends and Quinn is above terrain, she will cast Skystrike at the closest passable terrain (like flash).

replies.body:
Seems nice but people already hate the fact Valor and Quinn aren't as close as Kindred for some reason, and it would be a bit like Pantheon's ult.

Other than that, I just hate the fact Valor's size is literally impossible to keep track of and Quinn somehow has the strength of Pantheon.

"Other than that, I just hate the fact Valor's size is literally impossible to keep track of and Quinn somehow has the strength of Pantheon."

Can you please explain what you mean by this???

The consistency of Valor's size is questionable. In the splash art he shows as a somewhat large bird, like an eagle, but in-game he becomes much larger, arguably being almost/just as big as Quinn while "Tag Team" is active. This inconsistency of Valor's size questions Valor's weight, and since Quinn is capable of holding Valor on one arm it seems she *may* have superhuman strength.
Perhaps you can attribute the bigger size being due to Valor flying higher than the battlefield and therefore closer to the camera and appearing bigger.
Except Valor is a melee champion and would therefore need to be at ground level in order to attack.
to be fair birds are pretty light, even the big ones, so I doubt Quinn has superhuman strength.

True, but the issue is with Valor's size. There's just no consistency. If we assume "largest possibility" then it's possible we're looking at 50+ Kg for Valor's weight, not exactly an easy feat. It'd just be better if Riot was clear on Valor's actual size.
